Constructs a new distribution object.
@2@ Uses {{c|k}} and {{c|p}} as the distribution parameters.
@3@ Uses {{c|params}} as the distribution parameters.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|k|the ''k'' distribution parameter (number of trial successes)}}
{{par|p|the ''p'' distribution parameter (probability of a trial generating {{c|true}})}}
{{par|params|the distribution parameter set}}
{{par end}}

===Notes===
Requires that {{math|0 &lt; p â‰¤ 1}} and {{math|0 &lt; k}}.

If {{tt|1=p == 1}}, subsequent calls to the {{ltt|cpp/numeric/random/negative_binomial_distribution/operator()|operator()}} overload that does not accept a {{tt|param_type}} object will cause undefined behavior.

The default-constructed {{tt|std::negative_binomial_distribution}} is equivalent to the default-constructed {{lc|std::geometric_distribution}}.
